page.title: 18Education
page.content: Milburn school is situated at the top end of the Green.The present building was erected in 1851 after the previous one was burned down by one of the scholars;it had a thatched roof at that time.The present school is built of sandstone with a slate roof. It has one classroom with a cloakroom/kitchen attatched. Outside there are 2 toilets and 3 small storerooms.There is no playground so the pupils use part of the village green .The Headmistress is the only full time teacher, and a part time teacher comes in for 1.5 days per week.Monday - Friday the school is open and begins at 9.00 a.m. & finishes at 3.30 p.m.The children start during the academic year in which they are 5,and at the age of 11 are bussed to Appleby or have the choice to attend schools in Penrith.
